headline: Companies Are Replacing CEOs in Record Numbers—and They’re Getting Younger
summary: There hasn’t been such a big crop of new leaders running Corporate America in at least 16 years, and they have their hands full.

content.title: Companies Are Replacing CEOs in Record Numbers—and They’re Getting Younger
content.summary: There hasn’t been such a big crop of new leaders running Corporate America in at least 16 years, and they have their hands full.

headline: ByteDance vows to boost safeguards after AI model infringement claims
summary: Chinese tech giant ByteDance said it was taking steps to "strengthen current safeguards" after Hollywood heavyweights accused its new AI video model of copyright infringement.It added it was taking steps to "strengthen current safeguards" to prevent "unauthorised use of intellectual property and likeness by users".

content.title: ByteDance vows to boost safeguards after AI model infringement claims
content.summary: Chinese tech giant ByteDance said it was taking steps to "strengthen current safeguards" after Hollywood heavyweights accused its new AI video model of copyright infringement.It added it was taking steps to "strengthen current safeguards" to prevent "unauthorised use of intellectual property and likeness by users".

thumbnail.caption: ByteDance is best known globally as the company behind TikTok, but it is also a major AI player in China (Roslan RAHMAN)

headline: ByteDance to prevent unauthorized IP use on AI video after Disney threat
summary:
STORY: Bytedance will take steps to stop the unauthorized use of intellectual property on its new AI video generator.

The Chinese firm made the announcement Monday (February 16) following legal threats from U.S. studios, including Disney.

Seedance 2.0 was released last week and videos made on it have gone viral in China.

The AI model has been praised for its ability to produce cinematic storylines with only a few prompts.

However, a source told Reuters Disney sent a cease-and-desist letter to ByteDance.

They said the U.S. giant accused the Chinese firm of using Disney characters to train and power Seedance without permission.

While Bytedance said it was working to improve current safeguards over unauthorized use of intellectual property, it didn't describe the measures it was taking.

Variety reported Paramount Skydance also sent a cease-and-desist letter to ByteDance.

It reportedly accused the Chinese company of "blatant infringement" of its intellectual property.

Disney's move comes months after it signed a licensing deal with OpenAI.

It allows the startup to use characters from Star Wars, Pixar and Marvel franchises in its Sora video generator.

headline: McDonald's Tests High Protein Menu As GLP-1 Weight-Loss Drug Users Surge
summary: McDonald’s Corporation (NYSE:MCD) is adapting its menu as a growing number of Americans on GLP-1 weight-loss drugs, such as Ozempic and Wegovy, alter portion sizes, snacking habits, and beverage choices. McDonald's Tests High-Protein Options For GLP-1 Users During a Wednesday earnings call, CEO Chris Kempczinski said McDonald's is testing menu items to appeal to customers taking GLP-1 medications.
